titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Israel Jacobs was a U.S. Representative from 1791-1793. John Jacobs was a member of Assembly for Chester County. The Association Library Company was organized in 1757 and merged with the Library Company of Philadelphia in 1771. The eight-arch Skippack Bridge was built in 1792 over Skippack Creek on Germantown Pike in Lower Providence Township. The bridge was funded in part by money collected in a 1762 lottery.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of seven volumes related to the Jacobs family. The volumes have been bound together into one book. Sections include: dues paid for membership in the Association Library, 1761-1762; accounts for the Skippack Bridge lottery, 1766; appraisal, payments and disbursements of the Benjamin Jacobs estate; an account of the sales of the effects of Benjamin Jacobs, 1775; an account of the sales of the effects of John Hamer, 1783; accounts respecting the estate of John Hamer, 1784-1789; and an expense book related to the estate of Israel Jacobs, including travel notes.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Deposited by Eric Finkelstein; with bookplate of Samuel W. Pennypacker

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Historical Society of Pennsylvania: Jacobs family papers.
